com.roscopeco.ormdroid

Interface TypeMapping

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DateTypeMapping, EntityTypeMapping, NumericTypeMapping, StringTypeMapping

    public interface TypeMapping
    A mapping between Java types and SQL data. Implementations of this interface are registered with the TypeMapper class.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • javaType

        java.lang.Class<?> javaType()
        Returns:
        the Java type this mapping handles.

      • sqlType

        java.lang.String sqlType(java.lang.Class<?> concreteType)
        Returns:
        the SQL type for the specified concrete Java type.

      • encodeValue

        java.lang.String encodeValue(android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase db,
                           java.lang.Object value)

        Encode the specified value for storage in the database (i.e. for insertion into an SQL INSERT or UPDATE statement).

        Note: The supplied database parameter may be null. If this is the case then the framework does not expect any persistence to take place during the call. Implementations must account for this possibility, and may throw a sensible exception (e.g. IllegalArgumentException) to indicate that they cannot handle the specified object without a database handle.

        For an example of this, see EntityTypeMapping, which uses the database to persist transient objects. When the mapper is called during query creation (with a null database) an exception is thrown, indicating that it does not make sense to query for records matching a transient object.

        Parameters:
        db - The SQLiteDatabase to use, or null.
        value - The value to encode.
        Returns:
        An SQL compatible value string, suitably escaped for insertion into an SQL statement.

      • decodeValue

        java.lang.Object decodeValue(android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase db,
                           java.lang.Class<?> expectedType,
                           android.database.Cursor c,
                           int columnIndex)

        Decode the specified SQL data to a Java object.

        Parameters:
        db - The SQLiteDatabase to use, or null.
        expectedType - The Java type the framework expects in return.
        c - The database cursor to read from.
        columnIndex - The column index containing the data.
        Returns:
        An instance of expectedType representing the data.
